thread.title: Man United Exclusive: Zlatan Ibrahimovic offered huge £15m-a-season deal to join LA Galaxy
thread.title_full: Man United Exclusive: Zlatan Ibrahimovic offered huge £15m-a-season deal to join LA Galaxy

title: Man United Exclusive: Zlatan Ibrahimovic offered huge £15m-a-season deal to join LA Galaxy
text:
Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 8 Click to reveal the best odds on Zlatan Ibrahimovic's future 
And it has been suggested that Raiola wants a two-year deal for Ibrahimovic which is against United’s policy of only giving players over 30 one year deals at a time. 
Ibrahimovic is paid around £11million a season by United which is almost double Orlando City’s Kaka who is currently the highest paid player in the MLS. 
Kaka picked up around £5.9million a season but Galaxy are ready to offer him almost three times that amount to turn his back on United. GETTY Kaka earns £5.9million a season at MLS outfit Orlando City 
Galaxy are owned by American entertainment giants AEG the operators of London’s O2 Arena and the biggest owner of sports teams in the world. 
So the finances are available to tempt Ibrahimovic to the States a year after he rejected them to move to United and become one of their designated players. 
The club kept one of the two spots for designated players free after opting not to renew the contracts of Robbie Keane and Steven Gerrard at the end of last season. Related articles
